statement.p: This is a circle with radius 8.00 yd inscribed in a square with no side labeled. Round using the rules for measurements.

ol.li: What is the area of the square? \displaystyle\text{yd}^{{2}}
What is the area of the circle? \displaystyle\text{yd}^{{2}}
What is the area of the shaded section? \displaystyle\text{yd}^{{2}}

solution.p: The side length of the square is not given directly. However, because the circle is inscribed, a diameter of the circle is the same length as a side. Thus the square has side length \displaystyle{16.0}\ \text{ yd} and area \displaystyle{16.0}^{{2}}={256}\approx{256}\ \text{ yd}^{{2}}.
The area of the circle is \displaystyle\pi{\left({8.00}^{{2}}\right)}\approx{201.06192982975}\approx{201}\ \text{ yd}^{{2}}.
The area between them (shaded) is \displaystyle{256}-{201.06192982975}={54.938070170253}\approx{55}\ \text{ yd}^{{2}}.
